  • Lensed events

Lensed events

\(\textbf{Note:}\) for source properties and its distribution, refer to unlensed section

Detectable lensed events’ rate in a year

\begin{equation} \begin{split} R_L = \mathcal{N}^L \int & dz_s R_o^L(z_s) \,\mathcal{O}_{images}(z_s,\theta,\mu_i,\Delta t_i, \rho_{th}) \, \\ & \, P(\theta) P(\theta_L, z_L|\text{SL},z_s) P(\beta|\text{SL}) d\theta d\beta dz_L d\theta_L dz_s \end{split} \end{equation} \begin{equation} \tag{1} \end{equation}

  • for 2 image detectable

  • SNR operator over all images

\[\begin{split}\mathcal{O}_{images}(z_s,\theta,\mu_i,\Delta t_i, \rho_{th}) = \begin{cases} 1 & \sum_i^{images} \Theta[\rho(z_s,\theta,\mu_i,\Delta t_i)-\rho_{th}]\ge 2 \\ 0 & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

\begin{equation} \tag{2} \end{equation}

  • \(\mathcal{N}^L\) is the normalizing factor of merger rate distribution (with strong lensing condition applied) wrt \(z_s\) \begin{equation} \mathcal{N}^L = \int_{z_min}^{z_max} dz_s \frac{R_m(z_s)}{1+z_s} \frac{dV_c}{dz_s} \tau(z_s) \tag{3} \end{equation}

  • \(R_o^L(z_s)\) is the normalized merger-rate distribution for strong lensing case \begin{equation} R_o^L(z_s)= \frac{1}{\mathcal{N}^L}\frac{R_m(z_s)}{1+z_s} \frac{dV_c}{dz_s} \tau(z_s) \tag{4} \end{equation}

  • sampling of \(z_s\) is done through rejection sampling with the merger rate formula given above (lensing condition applied)

  • SNR operator over all images :nbsphinx-math:`begin{equation} mathcal{O}_{images}(z_s,theta,mu_i,Delta t_i, rho_{th}) =

    begin{cases}

    1 & sum_i^{images} Theta[rho(z_s,theta,mu_i,Delta t_i)-rho_{th}]ge 1\ 0 & text{otherwise}

    end{cases} tag{5}

    end{equation}`

  • Source param: \(\theta \in \{m_1,m_2,D_l,\iota,\phi,\psi,ra,dec\}\)

  • Lens param: \(\theta_L \in \{\sigma \text{(velocity-dispersion)},\; q \text{(axis-ratio)},\; \psi \text{(axis-rotaion)},\; \gamma \text{(spectral-index)},\)\(\; [\gamma_1,\gamma_2] \text{(external-shear)} \}\)

  • \(z_L\) : redshift of the galaxy lens

  • image param: \(\{\beta \text{(source position)},\; \mu \text{(magnification)},\; dt \text{(time-delay)}\}\)

  • sampling of lens parameter will be done wrt https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.06303

Sampling methods for lens parameters

Parameter

unit

\(\gamma_1,\gamma_2\)

None

Normal dist.

[mu,sigma]=[0,0.05]

[\(0\),\(\pi\)]

\(\gamma\)

None

Normal dist.

[mu,sigma]=[2,0.2]

\(z_L\) from \(D_L^c=r D_s^c\)

None

[\(z_{min}\),\(z_{max}\)]

\(r\)as in\(D_L^c=r D_s^c\)

None

\(P(x)=30x^2(1-x)^2\)

[0,1]

\(\sigma\) from\(\sigma=a 161\)

\(km\,s^{-1}\)

\(a\) as in \(\sigma=a 161\)

None

gamma distribution

\(q\) from\(q=1-b\)

None

\(b\) as in \(q=1-b\)

\(b<0.8\)

image parameters

  • Einstein radius: \begin{equation} \theta_E = \frac{4\pi \sigma^2}{c^2}\frac{D_{Ls}}{D_s} \tag{6} \end{equation}

  • Souce position in lens plane : \(\beta = [x,y] = [\eta\,cos(\phi),\eta\,sin(\phi)]\)

  • sampling methods:

Parameter

unit

sampling method

\(x\)

\(\theta_E\)

within caustic

\(y\)

radian

within caustic

montecarlo integration

\begin{equation} R_L = \mathcal{N}^U \left< \mathcal{O}_{images}(z_s,\theta,\mu_i,\Delta t_i, \rho_{th})\,\right>_{z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L \in \text{Sampled}[z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L]} \tag{7} \end{equation}

\begin{equation} R_L = \mathcal{N}^U \left< \,P_{det}^{max(\rho)_1} \,P_{det}^{max(\rho)_2} \,\right>_{z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L \in \text{Sampled}[z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L]} \tag{8} \end{equation}

\begin{equation} R_L = \frac{\mathcal{N}^U}{N} \sum_i \,P_{det}^{max(\rho)_1} \,P_{det}^{max(\rho)_2} \tag{9} \end{equation}

  • \(max(\rho)_1\) : \(1^{st}\) maximum SNR out of all the images for the given parameters {\(z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L\)}.

  • \(max(\rho)_2\) : \(2^{st}\) maximum SNR out of all the images for the given parameters {\(z_s,z_L,\theta,\theta_L\)}.

  • \(\rho_{th}\) for \(max(\rho)_2\) can lower than that of \(max(\rho)_1\) if it is a subthreshhold search.
